channel.description: Recent content in Basic Economics for SIE on Basic Eco Web site for SIE

item.title: Compilation of Q&A on Basic Economics part One
item.description: 2 questions on the “Exercise 2 : Cobb-Douglas Production Function” : i don’t get the answer the question 3 in this exercise when the power of \(x^0.5\) is changed to \(x−0.5\) The output elasticity with respect to \(x_2\) is defined as a ratio of marginal product and average product. We can write marg.product as: \[mP_{x_2} = \frac{\bar{x}_1^{0.3}}{2x_2^{0.5}} = \bar{x}_1^{0.3} \times 0.5 \times x_2^{-0.5}\] i don’t get the answer of the question number 1 The \(MPx_2\) and \(ApX_2\) , can you give me the steps on how you get this answer .

item.title: About
item.description: This is the website of the Lesson Basic Economics for Industrial Engineering taught at Grenoble INP Industrial Engineering and Management School. Here you find presentation of my activities

item.title: Basic Economics for IE
item.description: Lessons list This is the website of the Lesson Basic Economics for IE taught at Grenoble INP Industrial Engineering and Management School. First Lesson - 01/10/2020 - Thursday 13:30-16:30 Welcome page of First Lesson To do before Lesson 3: Production Case Study team work Presentation of the team works: Production case study Second Lesson - 05/10/2020 - Monday 12:00-13:30 Material for the Second Lesson Third Lesson - 08/10/2020 - Thurday 13:30-16:30 Material for the Third Lesson

item.title: Consumption Case Study
item.description: Student works Reading the Consumption Chapters Group work: Case study presentation on consumption cases - (15/10/2020) Pick a case to study in consumption between 9.2 - 9.13 This is a team work: subscribe on Consumption Googlesheet for group describtion and topic choice Statements: 3 slides presentation 1 slide: Introduction of the case 1 slide: Defining the economics topics usefull to analyse the case 1 slide: Case analysis: either by graph, model, equation, etc.

item.title: Consumption Case Study
item.description: Cases list CASE 2 Why Don’t Students Study More? Student Presentation CASE 3 The New Philanthropy Student Presentation Case 5 Do Rats Have Downward-Sloping Demand Curves? Student Presentation Case 7 Network Effects and the Diffusion of Communications Technologies and Computer Hardware and Software Student Presentation Case 8 Income and substitution effects and home ownership Student Presentation Case 9 Trash Pricing and Recycling Student Presentation

item.title: Production Case Study

item.title: Production Case Study
item.description: Cases list 1.1 Increasing Returns to Scale at Volkswagen Student Presentation 1.2 Food Intake and Productivity: An Example of Diminishing Returns 1.3 Economies of scale and hospitals in Scotland Student Presentation 1.4 Baseball Averages Student Presentation 1.5 Economies of Scale and Learning Effects in the Chemical Processing Industry Student Presentation 1.6 Economies of Scale and Scope in Apartment Management 1.7 Economies of Scale and Scope in DSP Production 1.8 Substitution of Inputs in Home Building
